s.text: In some ways, in fact, you could say that major league baseball wasn't really integrated until the Boston Red Sox--the last team to integrate--signed Pumpsie Green, a mediocre-hitting utility infielder.

The first black major-leaguer had to be exceptional, because a merely good player wouldn't have been able to convince people of what they didn't want to be convinced of, namely, that black players could play.

The first black major-leaguer had to be exceptional, because a merely good player wouldn't have been able to convince people of what they didn't want to be convinced of, namely, that black players could play.
But the old-boys' network is not a myth, and it still takes a conscious effort on the part of boards of directors and hiring committees to promote women.

As the sky-high pay for today's CEOs compared with their counterparts of twenty years ago demonstrates, the insular nature of boards of directors means that purely economic considerations do not always prevail.

The first black major-leaguer had to be exceptional, because a merely good player wouldn't have been able to convince people of what they didn't want to be convinced of, namely, that black players could play.
